learning: Pair Codex automation definitions with a launchd-backed headless runner; DB updates alone do not execute schedules.
evidence: standup-summary remained overdue (next_run_at in past) until com.openai.codex.automation-runner LaunchAgent was installed; cron.py run-now changed next_run_at but did not create automation_runs entries by itself
application: For setup, always run scripts/install_launch_agent.sh after creating automations and verify with launchctl print + automation_runs rows.

learning: Launchd automation installers should be path-agnostic and idempotent; reruns must no-op cleanly when plist content and loaded service are unchanged.
evidence: install_launch_agent.sh run twice: first output 'installed and started', second output 'already installed and loaded'; launchd_wrapper.sh now derives automation_runner.py via dirname instead of hardcoded /Users path
application: For machine-portable Codex skills, compute script paths relative to script location and compare generated plist content before bootstrap/bootout.

learning: When vendored fisher state is lost, keep fish/fish_plugins committed and let update fall back to that manifest.
evidence: fish -c 'fisher update; echo fisher_status:0' moved from fish_plugins missing error to fisher_status:0 after adding fish/fish_plugins and fallback in fish/functions/fisher.fish.
application: For fish plugin-manager regressions in this repo, recover from fish_plugins first and make fisher update tolerant of missing _fisher_plugins vars.

learning: For cas scale-out, isolate instance state files and use 1 integrator + N read-only workers (sandboxPolicy=readOnly + decline file-change approvals) to avoid cross-instance collisions.
evidence: Added codex/skills/mesh/scripts/mesh_cas_fleet_autopilot.mjs with per-instance state_dir, worker sandboxPolicy=readOnly, fileApprovalDecision=decline, and integrator-only patch application.
application: When exceeding per-instance [agents].max_threads, run multiple cas instances but keep all integration (patch/validation/plan) in one integrator; workers produce diffs only.

learning: When renaming a skill invocation token, prefer token/metadata and doc-surface updates while preserving runtime wire identifiers unless explicitly requested.
evidence: Updated token references from $cas to $cas across AGENTS/mesh/puff docs, kept cas/request wire IDs and script filenames unchanged, and validated with rg no-match checks plus quick_validate.
application: For future skill renames, scope first to invocation token and terminology, then run targeted grep + quick_validate to confirm no stale references.

learning: For full namespace migrations, include hidden files in the verification pass (rg -uu excluding .git) after path+token renames to catch residual historical references.
evidence: Completed cas->cas migration across paths, runtime events, commands, and docs; initial codex-only grep was clean but hidden .learnings.jsonl still contained cas tokens until the -uu scan and cleanup.
application: When a user asks for all instances, run both repo-scope and hidden-file-inclusive scans before declaring zero residual references.
